intro: Seseli athamantoides, commonly known as the clustered salsify, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Seseli athamantoides is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
